005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
009
010import java.util.stream.Stream;
011
012import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
013
014public interface IFunctionLibrary {
015
016  /**
017   * Retrieve the collection of function signatures in this library as a stream.
018   *
019   * @return a stream of function signatures
020   */
021  @NonNull
022  Stream<IFunction> stream();
023
024  /**
025   * Determine if there is a function with the provided namespace qualified name
026   * that supports the signature of the provided {@code arity}.
027   *
028   * @param name
029   *          the namespace qualified name of a group of functions
030   * @param arity
031   *          the count of arguments for use in determining an argument signature
032   *          match
033   * @return {@code true} if a function signature matches or {@code false}
034   *         otherwise
035   */
036  default boolean hasFunction(@NonNull IEnhancedQName name, int arity) {
037    return getFunction(name, arity) != null;
038  }
039
040  /**
041   * Retrieve the function with the provided namespace qualified name that
042   * supports the signature of the provided {@code arity}, if such a function
043   * exists.
044   *
045   * @param name
046   *          the namespace qualified name of a group of functions
047   * @param arity
048   *          the count of arguments for use in determining an argument signature
049   *          match
050   * @return the matching function or {@code null} if no match exists
051   */
052  IFunction getFunction(@NonNull IEnhancedQName name, int arity);
053}
